definitions.definition: The act of licking; a stroke of the tongue.
definitions.example: The cat gave its fur a lick.

definitions.definition: The amount of some substance obtainable with a single lick.
definitions.example: Give me a lick of ice cream.

definitions.definition: A quick and careless application of anything, as if by a stroke of the tongue.
A place where animals lick minerals from the ground.
definitions.example: The birds gathered at the clay lick.

definitions.definition: A small watercourse or ephemeral stream. It ranks between a rill and a stream.
definitions.example: We used to play in the lick.
Hit that wedge a good lick with the sledgehammer.
I didn't do a lick of work today.
There are some really good blues licks in this solo.

definitions.definition: A rate of speed. (Always qualified by good, fair, or a similar adjective.)
definitions.example: The bus was travelling at a good lick when it swerved and left the road.
You up for a lick tonight?

definitions.definition: To lap; to take in with the tongue.
definitions.example: She licked the last of the honey off the spoon before washing it.

definitions.definition: To defeat decisively, particularly in a fight.
definitions.example: My dad can lick your dad.
I think I can lick this.
